file_content.text: Once Project Noble Focus starts producing results, you'll see why it was necessary.
The Republic needed this project more than it needs a few deadbeat convicts.
It's done. Sulkhaz fell in battle.
There, you see, Graal? Problem solved.
You created that murdering slime, Senator. Far as I'm concerned, you're the problem.
You remember the warden. Afraid he doesn't much care for our little project.
You haven't met the deputy warden, have you? Good man; doesn't approve of our little project, though.
Your "little project" jeopardized the entire prison and violated countless ethics laws. You should be put away.
Torturing prisoners may fly with the Sith, but the Republic is above that sort of thing.
I agree.
The senator has much to answer for.
I agree.
I wouldn't mind tossing him in the stockade myself.
That makes two of us.
You think you're annoyed? I'm the one who had to clean up this mess.
You said it.
Sorry you got dragged into this. Never should have escalated this far.
I thought the project was classified. How'd you find out about it?
Wait, you know everything?
A Weequay found his way here, told us the whole story. Said you helped him. Poor sap looked like he needed it.
A few prisoners escaped and found their way here. Were scared half to death, rambling on about secret experiments and war games.
It's just a few convicts. Nobody will miss them.
Nobody cares, Graal.
Don't care. What the Senator did was unconscionable.
Spare me the show. The Republic has poured countless resources into containing these degenerates. It's high time we got something in return.
And we have. Project Noble Focus has given us a world of insight into the different species' strengths and limitations.
Just think, entire campaigns planned with each species' capabilities in mind. Our wartime efficiency will skyrocket.
That doesn't give you the right to experiment on prisoners.
It's still wrong.
What's right and what's necessary are rarely one and the same.
Your project drove the Rattataki to murder. That should tell you something.
What about the repercussions?
Yeah--that the Rattataki are some tough customers. Lesson learned.
That's true....
Whatever your feelings, this project--and our involvement in it--needs to remain classified.
Think of the backlash if this gets out. Every planet in the Republic will be up in arms.
Entire systems could secede over this. Surely a few dead convicts aren't worth all that.
Don't use the Republic to cover up your part in this. You broke the law.
You're going to jail for this.
That's right. It might get ugly, but the Republic needs to hear about this. I expect to see you back here real soon, Senator.
Hmph. We'll see.
He's right. Preserving the Republic's stability is more important than punishing these two.
Fine. We'll keep it a secret.
Get off my planet then, Senator.
Happy to.
With Sulkhaz dead and the experiments terminated, things should start to normalize there.
As soon as I have some guards to spare, I'll send them down there to clean up. Thanks for your help.
That settles that. Now to bigger concerns.
We've got trouble in the maximum security wing. General Skylast says some unidentified species is tearing through his men.
The Deep Prison is where the true horrors of Belsavis lie. If Skylast can't stop them, all this will have been for nothing. Help him.
This may be our only shot at Sulkhaz. Make it count.
Our satellites have picked up a large number of Rattataki in the Neimoidian compound. Up to their usual antics.
And here I was hoping it was just a social call.
The satellite images we've seen are pretty grisly. Far as we can tell, they're butchering the Neimoidians.
We've got to get down there and put a stop to it.
We should help them.
I'm not so concerned about saving Neimoidians as I am putting down the Rattataki.
Don't the Rattataki ever sleep?
These guys are relentless.
Apparently not. It's been a steady stream of mayhem since they escaped.
I'm not sticking my neck out just to save a few convicts.
Too bad for them.
I could care less about the Neimoidians. We've got bigger fish to fry.
We've confirmed that Sulkhaz, the Blood of Talath's ringleader, is personally overseeing this latest massacre.
He's everything you could want in a fanatical leader: loud, ruthless and utterly demented.
Eliminating Sulkhaz will take the fight out of the Rattataki, show them who's in charge. You've got to get down there and stop him.
Whatever it takes to end this madness.
You've got it.
There are times when violence is a necessary step toward peace.
I will do what I must.
This Sulkhaz is about to find out how we do things in Havoc Squad.
Gladly.
One ex-nutcase, coming up.
I'd be happy to.
When I get back, we're going to have a little chat about this project of yours.
All right. But then we talk.
Fine, fine. Just get it done.
Expect a bloody fight. Sulkhaz rarely does anything without someone dying.
Make sure it's not you.
Count me out. [Refuse quest]
We can't afford to let this opportunity slip by!
Senator Tudos told me you diffused the bomb. Not a moment too soon.
And I see you brought back the stolen power cores. I'll have our engineers start modifying the warden droids immediately.
The Rattataki still have the run of the wing, but at least we've contained them... for now.
We need to talk about Project Noble Focus.
About these experiments....
There'll be time enough for that once the Rattataki have been dealt with. Focus on the crisis at hand for now.
That's one crisis averted. What's our next move?
What now?
Now's the time to wipe them out and be done with this.
Let's finish them off.
You just might get your shot at that.
You've got to disarm that bomb before the Rattataki set it off.
Colonel Hauer? Warden Graal told me you could use a hand here.
That's right. Heard you put down a riot in his neck of the woods. Heck of a feat.
Certainly piqued my interest. Senator Tudos, chairman of the Penal Oversight Committee. Delighted to finally meet you.
Been a while since we saw any new friendlies out here. Good to have you here. I'm Colonel Hauer. A word, if I may.
Yes, do come in. Senator Tudos, chairman of the Penal Oversight Committee. A pleasure.
You know, I'm about to propose some new legislation to the Senate--bold stuff, very controversial. A Jedi's endorsement would go a long way....
You know, I applied for military service myself when I was your age. Didn't pan out, but I do love a good war story....
Maybe later we can talk about shifting some, ahem, sensitive cargo to my estates on Coruscant....
Surviving a planet-wide riot is no easy thing. No doubt you trekked through fire and blood to get here.
Senator. Focus.
Right. Things have spiraled out of control here--thousands of prisoners on the loose, segregation thrown out the door. A veritable frenzy of interspecies violence.
Then I'd hop on the first ship out of here. This is no place for a Senator.
You're not safe here.
Tempting, but the Republic has invested no small sum into this facility. I need to make sure certain... interests are being protected.
You kept the prisoners segregated? What for?
Segregation?
These criminal types are notoriously intolerant of other species. The genocide we've seen here only proves it.
Let them go at each other's throats. Makes our job easier.
Fine by me.
It crossed my mind. But as their duly appointed representative, I owe it to them to stamp out this anarchy.
Our biggest concern is a tribe of Rattataki called the Blood of Talath. Bunch of raving fanatics bent on slaughtering every other species.
They are ambitious, crafty. Recently took to ambushing warden droids and stripping away their power cores.
Intel suggests they're compiling the stolen power cores into one massive bomb. Probably mean to blast their way out of here.
Throw everything you've got at them. Contain them while you still can.
Stop them.
Out of the question. I have my hands full just keeping this station secure.
They're as likely to hurt themselves as anyone else. Perhaps they can be reasoned with.
Can you talk sense into them?
"Reason" is not a virtue I'd attribute to these guys. Have yet to see them communicate without killing someone.
The infrastructure here looks pretty solid. You don't think it'll hold?
Will that work?
The walls are reinforced with duracrete, but even they won't withstand a few dozen power core explosions.
With any luck, those loonies will cross a wire and blow themselves up.
Maybe they'll screw it up.
Unlikely. They're crazy, not stupid.
Pretty resourceful for a bunch of murderous lunatics.
Clever.
They're organized, I'll give them that.
Then they'll be somebody else's problem. Good riddance.
At least they'll be gone.
It's not that simple.
If the Rattataki break free, they'll kill anyone they find--guards, prisoners....
Not to mention Senators. You've got to disable that bomb and contain this madness.
Those Rattataki aren't going anywhere.
Leave it to me.
Splendid! I knew we could count on you.
Can't the colonel do it?
Ensuring the Senator's immediate safety is my top priority right now.
It'd probably be best to keep the Rattataki from acquiring any more power cores.
If you can retrieve some of the power cores they stole, we should be able to modify the warden droids to prevent future tampering.
Dismantling that bomb comes first, though.
There should be a security terminal somewhere in the area. Report in when you've diffused the bomb.
Not my duty. [Refuse quest]
I see. Far be it from me to force you.
This is the safest place in the entire wing.
Guess I have to go long.
Barely worth my time.
